member.name: T:PresentationTheme.Aero.Win10.ButtonChrome
member.summary: Creates a theme-specific look for elements.

remarks.para: The actual appearance of a is dependent on which theme is active on the user's system. The properties of this class allow WPF to set the appearance based on the current theme.
does not actually render a button but instead provides visual states allowing its to accurately render the appearance of buttons.

member.name: M:PresentationTheme.Aero.Win10.DoubleUtil.AreClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns whether or not two doubles are "close". That is, whether or not they are within epsilon of each other. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication.
member.param: The first double to compare.
The second double to compare.
member.returns: bool - the result of the AreClose comparision.

member.name: M:PresentationTheme.Aero.Win10.DoubleUtil.LessThan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: LessThan - Returns whether or not the first double is less than the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly less than *and* not within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication.
member.param: The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.

member.name: M:PresentationTheme.Aero.Win10.DoubleUtil.GreaterThan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns whether or not the first double is greater than the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly greater than *and* not within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication.
member.param: The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.

member.name: M:PresentationTheme.Aero.Win10.DoubleUtil.LessThanOrClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns whether or not the first double is less than or close to the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly less than or within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication.
member.param: The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.

member.name: M:PresentationTheme.Aero.Win10.DoubleUtil.GreaterThanOrClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: GreaterThanOrClose - Returns whether or not the first double is greater than or close to the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly greater than or within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication.
member.param: The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.
member.returns: The result of the GreaterThanOrClose comparision.

member.name: T:PresentationTheme.Aero.Win10.EqualsConverter
member.summary: Converts an array of objects to a boolean specifying whether all objects are equal.
member.example:
The following checks whether the Value property is equal to the Maximum property.
<theme:EqualsConverter x:Key="EqualsConverter"/> <DataTrigger Value="True"> <DataTrigger.Binding> <MultiBinding Converter="{StaticResource EqualsConverter}"> <Binding Path="Value" RelativeSource="{RelativeSource Self}"/> <Binding Path="Maximum" RelativeSource="{RelativeSource Self}"/> </MultiBinding> </DataTrigger.Binding> </DataTrigger>

member.name: M:PresentationTheme.Aero.Win10.EqualsConverter.Convert(System.Object[],System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts an array of objects to a boolean specifying whether all objects are equal.
member.param: The array of values.
The type of the binding target property.
The converter parameter to use. Not used.
The culture to use in the converter. Not used.
member.returns: if all objects in are equal; otherwise .

member.name: T:PresentationTheme.Aero.Win10.MenuScrollingEnabledConverter
member.summary: Data binding converter to handle whether repeat buttons in scrolling menus are enabled.

member.name: M:PresentationTheme.Aero.Win10.MenuScrollingEnabledConverter.Convert(System.Object[],System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts a state to a value indicating whether a specific scrolled percentage is reached.
member.param: values indicating the current state of the .
The type of the binding target property.
A value indicating the scrolled percentage at which the converter returns . Use 0.0 or 100.0 to target the beginning or end respectively.
The culture to use in the converter. Not used.

member.name: T:PresentationTheme.Aero.Win10.TabItemKind
member.summary: Specifies the kind of a with respect to a reference tab. The selected tab of a is automatically the reference tab. If a tab row has no selected tab, the last tab is used as reference.
